alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Colleton; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 10:25PM EDT until July 15 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1023 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rainfall across portions of Charleston, Dorchester and Berkeley Counties. While additional flooding is unlikely tonight, it will take awhile longer for flood waters to diminish. A flash flood warning remains in effect for Ladson and Hanahan as well as portions of North Charleston and Summerville. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Ladson, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Daniel Island, Ravenel, Cottageville, Knightsville, Givhans, Jedburg, Sangaree, College Park, Jacksonboro, Round O, Ashepoo, Ritter, Green Pond and Huger.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
